titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Kate Alexander Hill (1873-1960) was appointed as a career missionary under the Women's Board of the United Presbyterian Church of North America in 1896. Until her retirement in 1943, she served in Lyallpur, Sangla Hill, Sargodha and Sialkot Districts in India (now Pakistan).

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised primarily of a photo album from Hill's missionary service in Sialkot, India with the India Mission, 1896-1904. The album includes photographs of staff and students of the India Mission, landscapes, and images of mission buildings (hospitals, schools, and churches) in various locations, including Sialkot, Rasrur, Jhelum, and Dharmsala. The collection also includes a small memo book that provides descriptions of some of the photographs in the album.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Kate Alexander Hill papers (RG 53) and David Smith Lytle papers (accession 96 1003a).
